com.softserve.edu.algorithmTasks

Class EuclideanAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.softserve.edu.algorithmTasks.EuclideanAlgorithm

  • public class EuclideanAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    The EuclideanAlgorithm class consists from methods for finding: - the greatest common divisor; - the least common multiple; for two non-negative integers with next options: a) two integers don't equal '0' at one time; b) one integer could be equal or greater than another integer.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yura

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EuclideanAlgorithm() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int gcd(int m, int n)
      This method, which uses the Euclidean algorithm, is used to find the greatest common divisor (GCD) for two non-negative integers, which are the first and the second parameters in method.
      int lcm(int m, int n)
      This method is used to find the least common multiple(LCM) for two non-negative integers, using the Euclidean algorithm with method 'gcd(int m, int n)'.
      int recursionGCD(int m, int n)
      This method returns the same as 'gcd(int m, int n)' method, but only using an Euclidean algorithm with recursion to find out greatest common divisor(GCD) for two non-negative integers, which are the first and the second parameters in method.
      int recursionLCM(int m, int n)
      This method returns the same as 'lcm(int m, int n)' method, but only using an Euclidean algorithm with recursion to find out the least common multiple(LCM) for two non-negative integers, which are the first and the second parameters in method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EuclideanAlgorithm

        public EuclideanAlgorithm()

    • Method Detail

      • gcd

        public int gcd(int m,
               int n)
        This method, which uses the Euclidean algorithm, is used to find the greatest common divisor (GCD) for two non-negative integers, which are the first and the second parameters in method.
        Parameters:
        m - first parameter to analyze
        n - second parameter to analyze
        Returns:
        int The greatest common divisor.

      • recursionGCD

        public int recursionGCD(int m,
                        int n)
        This method returns the same as 'gcd(int m, int n)' method, but only using an Euclidean algorithm with recursion to find out greatest common divisor(GCD) for two non-negative integers, which are the first and the second parameters in method.
        Parameters:
        m - first parameter to analyze
        n - second parameter to analyze
        Returns:
        int The greatest common divisor for the parameters of the method.

      • lcm

        public int lcm(int m,
               int n)
        This method is used to find the least common multiple(LCM) for two non-negative integers, using the Euclidean algorithm with method 'gcd(int m, int n)'.
        Parameters:
        m - first parameter to analyze (non-negative integer)
        n - second parameter to analyze (non-negative integer)
        Returns:
        int The least common multiple

      • recursionLCM

        public int recursionLCM(int m,
                        int n)
        This method returns the same as 'lcm(int m, int n)' method, but only using an Euclidean algorithm with recursion to find out the least common multiple(LCM) for two non-negative integers, which are the first and the second parameters in method.
        Parameters:
        m - first parameter to analyze (non-negative integer)
        n - second parameter to analyze (non-negative integer)
        Returns:
        int The least common multiple
